fr.ecp.IS1220.myVelib.core

Class Station

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.ecp.IS1220.myVelib.core.Station
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<Station>

    public class Station
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Station>, java.io.Serializable
    This class represents a station.
    Author:
    Valentin
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  Station.State
      A nested class of the class Station that depicts the state of the station at a given moment in time.

        Constructor of class Station. The station created is empty.
        Parameters:
        localization - the localization of the station
        isPlus - type of station (true for Plus, false for Standard)
        name - name of the station

        isPlus - type of station (true for Plus, false for Standard)

        numberOfSlots - number of parking slots

        public java.util.ArrayList<Station.State> getHistory()
        Returns the full history of the station, ie. the list of states of the station since its creation.
        Returns:
        the history of the station

      • numberOfBicycles

        public int numberOfBicycles()
        Returns the number of available bicycles in the station. Bicycles parked on an offline parking slot are not taken into account.
        Returns:
        the number of available bicycles

      • numberOfBicycles

        public int numberOfBicycles(java.lang.String bicycleType)
        Returns the number of available bicycles of a given type in the station. Bicycles parked on an offline parking slot are not taken into account.
        Parameters:
        bicycleType - A string corresponding to the type of bicycle
        Returns:
        the number of available bicycles of given type

      • numberOfFreeSlots

        public int numberOfFreeSlots()
        Returns the number of parking slots available in the station, ie. online slots holding no bicycle.
        Returns:
        the number of free slots

      • getFreeParkingSlot

        public ParkingSlot getFreeParkingSlot()
                               throws NoParkingSlotAvailableException
        Returns a free parking slot (online and holding no bicycle) of the station if such a parking slot exists, otherwise throws a RuntimeException.
        Returns:
        a free parking slot
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - when there is no available parking slot
        NoParkingSlotAvailableException

      • getParkingSlot

        public ParkingSlot getParkingSlot(int index)
                           throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                  java.lang.RuntimeException
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        java.lang.RuntimeException

      • isFull

        public boolean isFull()
        Returns true if there is no free parking slot available in the station. If there is at least one free parking slot (online and holding no bicycle), returns false.
        Returns:
        true if the station is full, false otherwise

      • getBicycle

        public Bicycle getBicycle()
                   throws NoBicycleAvailableException
        Returns an available bicycle of the station (the first available in the order of parking slots) if it exists AND empties the corresponding parking slot. If no such bicycle exists, throws a RuntimeException.
        Returns:
        an available bicycle
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - When no bicycle is available
        NoBicycleAvailableException

      • getBicycle

        public Bicycle getBicycle(java.lang.String bicycleType)
                   throws NoBicycleAvailableException
        Returns an available bicycle of given type of the station (the first available in the order of parking slots) if it exists AND empties the corresponding parking slot. If no such bicycle exists, throws a RuntimeException.
        Parameters:
        bicycleType - A string corresponding on the bicycle type
        Returns:
        an available bicycle of given type
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - When no bicycle is available
        NoBicycleAvailableException

      • isBicycle

        public boolean isBicycle()
        Returns true if there is at least one available bicycle in the station. Returns false otherwise.
        Returns:
        true if there is a bicycle, false otherwise

      • isBicycle

        public boolean isBicycle(java.lang.String bicycleType)
        Returns true if there is at least one available bicycle of given type in the station. Returns false otherwise.
        Parameters:
        bicycleType - a String that correspond to the type of bicycle wanted
        Returns:
        true if there is a bicycle of given type, false otherwise

      • getOneBicycleType

        public java.lang.String getOneBicycleType()
        Returns one available type of bicycle in the station. For example, if the station contains electrical and mechanical bicycles, this method can return either "electrical" or "mechanical" (depending on the order of the bicycles appearance in the parking slots). If no bicycle is available, throws a RuntimeException.
        Returns:
        a type of bicycle as a String
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - occurs when no bicycle is available

      • populate

        public void populate(java.util.ArrayList<Bicycle> bicycleList)
        This method populates a station with the list of bicycles passed in argument. Only the available parking slots are populated. The bicycles are attributed to each available parking slot by order of appearance, starting from the beginning of the list, until all bicycles have been attributed or until there are no more available parking slots.
        Parameters:
        bicycleList - a population of bicycles

      • getId

        public long getId()
        Returns:
        id of the station

        Returns:
        true if the station is Plus, false otherwise

      • setOffline

        public void setOffline(java.lang.Boolean isOffline)
        A call to this method sets the station and all its parking slots in the state specified in argument.
        Parameters:
        isOffline - true to set the station offline, false to set it online

      • getParkingSlots

      • addParkingSlot

        public void addParkingSlot(ParkingSlot parkingSlot)
                    throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Adds a given parking slot to the station. This method is automatically called when creating a parking slot associated to the station.
        Parameters:
        parkingSlot - the parking slot you to add
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when the parkingSlot is already in the station or linked to another station

      • createParkingSlots

                        throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Adds a number of new parking slots to the station.
        Parameters:
        quantity - number of new parking slots
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when the quantity is not positive

      • getTargetOf

        public java.util.ArrayList<Travel> getTargetOf()
        Returns:
        the list of planned rides heading to the station

      • addTargetOf

        public void addTargetOf(Travel travel)
        This method is called when a planned ride Travel suggests this station either as a start station or end station to a user. The Travel then becomes an observer of this station and is notified if needed.
        Parameters:
        travel - The Travel object

      • removeTargetOf

        public void removeTargetOf(Travel travel)
        Removes a planned ride Travel which was previously observing the station.
        Parameters:
        travel - an planned ride observer of the station

      • updateStatus

        public void updateStatus()
        This method is automatically called when any operation (rental, return, offline, online, parking slot creation) is performed in the station, including any of its parking slots.
        It does two things :
        - If the station becomes full, or empty of some bicycle type, as a consequence of this operation, notifies all the planned rides Travel currently observing the station (to rent a bicycle or return one) which could be affected by this change
        - Creates a new instance of State and adds it to the station history

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(Station o)
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Station>

      • historyTrace

        public java.lang.String historyTrace()
        Returns a representation of the full history of the station, ie. the list of states of the station since its creation.
        Returns:
        a representation of the full history of the station

      • getCurrentState

        public Station.State getCurrentState()
        Returns:
        the most recent state of the station
